h2.a: School Closure Update – Remainder of the School Year

div.p: Dear Tonica Grade School Students, Parents and Staff:

Now that Governor Pritzker has ordered schools to suspend in-person learning for the remainder of the year, TGS will be focusing on what that means for us as a community of learners. We had various scenarios regarding what learning and the end of the school year would look like, but we now have a better understanding of what path we need to take.

Our first and most important priority now is to focus very highly on remote learning and ensuring the best possible engagement for students. This plan includes teacher guidance and support for parents as they assist their child/children. The Recommendations for Engagement are now most important as they will continue to target the critical skills students will need to enter the next grade level. Teachers will be providing weekly Engagement Activities via email, ClassDojo, Google Classroom or other ways provided by the teacher. Parents should communicate with each teacher if there is something that would best be provided via paper packet or pdf email file. If a paper copy is needed, they will do their best to have those available for pick-up on the Tuesday and Wednesday meal bag time; otherwise e-versions through email, classdojo or google classroom will be the method of providing learning activities.

The plan for the remainder of the year is to have Monday through Thursday for Engagement activities (the lesson plans provided to you). Fridays would not have new items but be a great time for make-up or engaging in the Extension or Specials suggestions. Teachers will use Friday for planning the next week’s lessons and may have limited time to provide feedback and connect with students. The last week for new lessons will be the week of May 11th.

Elementary Engagement Activities have three levels of importance – Each student should look to engage in the English-Language Arts/Reading/Spelling and Math activities that are provided for the week. The second level would be Social Studies and Science activities. The third level to work on would be Extension Activities. These Extension activities would also be art and music subjects, which are just as important for continued student learning. Please find time to enjoy these activities as well. Ideally teachers would see daily engagement and feedback; however, understanding each situation is different at minimum the expectation is to send assignments back and have contact weekly or to start the next week.

Junior High students will continue to engage through Google Classroom with classes spread out over the week. Each class subject should be attempted with teachers providing a range of activities to meet critical skills and then Extension Activities.

Included in our primary focus is to also continue to provide meal-bags on a weekly basis. The pattern should remain the same with pick-ups on Tuesday and Wednesday, coordinated with remote learning material availability each week with the week of May 18th being the last week for meal bags. The pick-up times should also remain the same from 7 am to 10 am.

Three uses for the Tuesday and Wednesday mornings from 7:00 – 10:00 a.m. are: meal-bag pickup, drop off of student work that was not able to be sent electronically and pick-up of requested printed copies of materials for families with limited internet or no screens larger than a cell phone. Please coordinate the request for printed materials with the classroom teacher.
There are many other aspects that the school will be working on and those you may have questions about such as:

ul.li:
Will school start again next year or will our school calendar change next year?
Guidance from the Governor’s office and ISBE will determine this in the future

What about my child’s personal items and items provided by the school?
Our primary focus is on remote learning and meal-bags. Staff will be working on organizing each student’s personal items for pick-up the last week of school during the final meal bag distribution that week on May 19th and 20th.
Items provided by the school would be returned during the same time.

I paid for certain activities or items, do I get a refund? – See below but the timeline for reimbursement could be June or July
Track fees will be reimbursed.
Bowling fees went directly to the bowling alley; however, the owner has since sold the business but will send TGS a check for the unused portion. We will then provide payment back to the team members.
The yearbook is still in progress but it may not see a delivery date until the summer or early next school year. If the yearbook is not provided funds will be returned or can carry over to next year.
Lunch accounts – The school refunds lunch funds to 8th grade parents that do not have any other children in the school. Remaining lunch accounts hold over to the following year or are reimbursed for students that transfer to another school.
Book/Registration Fees – As remote learning has taken place of in-person learning these fees would not be refunded.
Kindergarten Snack/Milk – Fees would be carried over into a student’s lunch account for next year
GRADUATION!!! Will there be a GRADUATION CEREMONY?

div.p: This one is a little more complex; however, there is every intent on holding some type of ceremony or recognition. Several factors will help guide us in the right direction for an in-person celebration. First, the Governor has to lift the stay home order and we will need to consider any crowd/group size capacity as well. Second, IDPH guidelines for social distancing will also be a factor.

The school building might not be available due to a pre-scheduled construction process. Fire doors and the fires system will be part of the project with an occupancy certificate required to have activities and classes. The project would be completed before the current return date to school for next year. We have asked the contractor to move us up on the schedule, if possible, for the inside work.

A graduation celebration may have a different look, location and occur over summer break but be held before school resumes in the fall. A virtual ceremony is possible with that avenue being explored. So many things have been different this year but Graduation is the pinnacle of attending Tonica Grade School and we want to as much as possible celebrate the transition from 8th grade to high school.

The staff of TGS knows that remote learning is not optimum and each parent/guardian and home may have many other life events going on at the same time. Parents who are essential workers that are trying to juggle learning time with their children especially at the younger levels that need quite a bit of direct guidance, taking care of family members or others that need assistance, trying to share devices needed for working at home and remote learning and other situations. The TGS staff understand these unique situations and commend our parents and students for their perseverance and engagement in the remote learning process.

We miss seeing each of you daily, parents dropping off and picking up children at the end of the day and will miss the several great community events that showcased our student and staff talents. Parents are the best advocate and resource for student engagement. Together we can accomplish a very successful, albeit scaled back, educational experience for our children.
Please look for the weekly remote learning engagement activities, provide feedback to teachers and most importantly, be safe and follow suggested guidelines for being out in the public.
Mr. Schneider and the Staff of TGS.
